meanings.definition: In a mischievous or playful manner.
meanings.sent1: She grinned impishly as she hid behind the door.
meanings.sent2: The child skipped impishly down the hallway.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wagged its tail impishly as it chewed on the slipper.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled impishly as she teased her brother.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel chattered impishly as it stole the nuts.

meanings.definition: Characterized by playful or mischievous behavior.
meanings.sent1: He had an impishly charming smile that won everyone over.
meanings.sent2: The impishly playful kitten batted at the yarn ball.
meanings.sent3: The impishly clever fox outsmarted the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her impishly mischievous nature always kept things interesting.
meanings.sent5: The impishly adventurous puppy explored every corner of the garden.
